p.codeblock: virtual int enableLoopbackRecording(bool enabled, const char* deviceName = NULL) = 0;
public abstract int EnableLoopbackRecording(bool enabled, string deviceName = "");
Future<void> enableLoopbackRecording( {required bool enabled, String? deviceName});

section.title: Details
section.p: If you enable loopback audio capturing, the output of the sound card is mixed into the audio stream sent to the other end.

ul.li: This method applies to the macOS and Windows platforms only.

macOS does not support loopback audio capture of the default sound card. If you need to use this function, use a virtual sound card and pass its name to the deviceName parameter. Agora recommends using AgoraALD as the virtual sound card for audio capturing.
You can call this method either before or after joining a channel.

plentry.pd:
Whether to enable loopback audio capturing.
: Enable loopback audio capturing.
: (Default) Disable loopback audio capturing.
The device name of the virtual sound card. The default value is set to NULL, which means using AgoraALD for loopback audio capturing.

ul.li: macOS: The device name of the virtual sound card. The default value is set to NULL, which means using AgoraALD for loopback audio capturing.
Windows: The device name of the sound card. The default is set to NULL, which means the SDK uses the sound card of your device for loopback audio capturing.

section.p: When the method call succeeds, there is no return value; when fails, the exception is thrown; you need to catch the exception and handle it accordingly.
